intro: Appella, commonly known as the sweet potato vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant, variegated foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its roots, which are the edible part, vary in color from orange to purple and are rich in nutrients. Appella is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive leaves and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
